Package bridges.gui

Class CustomDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • bridges.gui.CustomDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MessageDialog, NewPuzzleDialog
    public abstract class CustomDialog
extends java.awt.Dialog
    The CustomDialog provides some basic functionality used by:
    - MessageDialog and
    - NewPuzzleDialog

    like:
    - setting the title
    - closing the dialog, when the user presses 'X' and
    - scaling and positioning the window.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        modal - - whether or not this dialog should block access to the owner.
        title - - the title of the new dialog.

      • CustomDialog

        public CustomDialog​(java.awt.Frame owner,
                    boolean modal,
                    java.lang.String title,
                    double widthRatio,
                    double heightRatio)
        Create a new Dialog with the given owner and modality and title and size information.
        Parameters:
        owner - - the owner frame.
        modal - - whether or not this dialog should block access to the owner.
        title - - the title of the new dialog.
        widthRatio - - indicates how many percent of the width of the owner frame is used for the width, so if the owner has a width of 600 pixel and widthRatio is set to 0.5 the dialog will have a width of 300 pixel.
        heightRatio - - same as widthRatio but for the height.
